questions.question: What is the empirical formula of the synthesized [((S)-ibuprofen)3UO2][Na] complex?
What technique was used to measure the quantum yield of the [((S)-ibuprofen)3UO2][Na] complex under UV excitation?
questions.answer: The quantum yield was measured by the relative method using 9,10-diphenylanthracene as a standard.

questions.question: How does the radiative lifetime of the [((S)-ibuprofen)3UO2][Na] complex change when excited at 280 nm compared to 450 nm?
questions.answer: The radiative lifetime at 480 nm is 4.44 μs (± 0.1) under 280 nm excitation and 4.96 μs (± 0.4 μs) under 450 nm excitation.

questions.question: True or False: The circularly polarized luminescence (CPL) spectra of the [((S)-ibuprofen)3UO2][Na] complex were collected using a bandpass of 13 nm.
What was the method used for the enantiomeric resolution of racemic ibuprofen?
questions.answer: Enantiopure (R)- and (S)- ibuprofen were resolved by an adaptation of a previously reported procedure using (R)-α-phenylethylamine and (S)-α-phenylethylamine.

questions.question: What is the significance of the Flack parameter in the XRD structural refinement parameters for [((S)-ibuprofen)3UO2][Na]?
questions.answer: The Flack parameter is used to determine the absolute configuration of chiral molecules in crystal structures. A value close to 0 or 1 indicates a pure enantiomer.

questions.question: True or False: The luminescence decay curves of the [((S)-ibuprofen)3UO2][Na] complex were collected with fixed emission monitoring at 480 nm after excitation at 295 nm.
What was the observed phenomenon when the [((S)-ibuprofen)3UO2][Na] complex was titrated with cyclohexylacetic acid?
questions.answer: The fluorescence of the complex was quenched upon titration with cyclohexylacetic acid, indicating ligand dissociation.

questions.question: True or False: The CPL spectra of the [((S)-ibuprofen)3UO2][Na] complex under UV excitation were collected using a 45º cell orientation.
What was the purpose of using 2-methyl THF in the low-temperature (77 K) normalized emission spectrum of the (S)- complex?
questions.answer: 2-methyl THF was used to obtain a glass suitable for photophysical measurements at low temperatures.
